questions.name: User Interface Count
questions.prompt: Are there multiple user interfaces in the system design?

answers.scope: There are multiple user interfaces throughout the space.

questions.name: User Interface Synchronization
questions.prompt: Since there are multiple user interfaces in the system, how will they act?

answers.prompt: The user interfaces will be synchronized, always showing the same page at the same time.
The user interfaces will not be sychronized, allowing for different control pages to be viewed by different touchpanels at the same time.

answers.scope: There is a single user interface in the space.

questions.name: User Interface Development
questions.prompt: Does this project require CCS to develop a user interface from scratch?

answers.prompt: No, the client will be providing a standardized UI template file to CCS for modification as needed.
answers.scope: The client will provide, prior to programming a template file for CCS to modify for this project.

answers.prompt: No, this client is one we have worked with previously, and therfore we have a template file for modification.
answers.scope: This is a previous client of CCS and a template file will be utilized to adhere to the client's standard

answers.prompt: No, the client has chosen to use a CCS standardized UI that will have colors and logos added only.
answers.scope: The client has chosen to use one of CCS' standardized user interface templates, and as such only colors and logos will be changed or modified to match the clients brand.
CCS will design a new user interface for the client, providing N revisions.

questions.name: Branding Guidelines
questions.prompt: Does the client have a branding guideline for CCS to utilize in the creation of user interfaces?

answers.prompt: Yes, the client will provide CCS a branding guideline.
answers.scope: The client will provide, before user interface programming is to begin a branding guideline document.

answers.prompt: No, the client does not have, or cannot provide a branding guideline.
answers.scope: The client cannot provide a branding guideline document so CCS will make its best effort to match styling and colors where possible.

questions.name: Logos
questions.prompt: Does the client have access to high resolution logos for CCS to insert in the user interfaces?

answers.scope: The client will provide, before user interface programming is to begin, high quality logo files in .png format of no less than 500x500 pixels.
The client cannot provide high resolution logo files, so CCS will make its best effort to obtain logo files from publicly available websites or other resources.
